title: iPhone/iPad
custom_preconds:
Prior to the day a series begins the Scoreboard will show Game 1, Game 2, Game 3, etc.

On the day of the first game, the status will show Series tied 0-0.

Each morning (example Monday) 10AM flip, the status of a game will show the updated series result prior to that day's game. After the day's game goes final that status will update with the new match up status for that day. The matchup status will then lock on that day. The next day's (Tuesday) matchup will start with the status of the night before (the night before status WILL NOT CHANGE) and will update when the Tuesday's game goes final.

This will continue until the series is complete where the winning team will show (Yankees win series 4-3).

ALL GAMES NOT NEEDED WILL BE REMOVED FROM SCOREBOARD

Scoreboard View Format:
Series tied 0-0

Yankees lead series 2-1
Series tied 2-2

DS Only (best of 5):

Yankees win series 3-2

LCS and World Series (best of 7):
Yankees lead series 3-0

Yankees lead series 3-2
Series tied 3-3

Yankees win series 4-0
Yankees win series 4-1
Yankees win series 4-2
Yankees win series 4-3

On future dates:
The Series and game number will appear. Ex: NLDS B, Game 2

On the team view and in the drawer on the scoreboard, we will replace the
team name with the Club code. This will require a grammar change as well:

NYY leads series 1-0
NYY wins series 4-0

On the Postseason view, we have one additional state before "Series tied
0-0" which reads:

Series begins Tue. Oct. [Date], 7:30PM ET

Editorial then changes that to:

Series begins tonight, 7:30PM ET

We do not show the status for future games, but we do show it for past
games with the status as the game ended on the night it was played.
The day of the game at the 10AM flip the status will update with that from the last game played. When the game for that day ends, it will update and lock on that status starting the process over again.
